"Where are we?  Well first of all, we're in Atlantis.  But I don't
think that was the answer you had in mind." answered Lord Perseus.

"This city is in the middle of the ocean and of course we're on planet
 earth; and which is rich in the energon Unicron so craves."


On 4/28/07, Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:
> Dinobot: I'm afraid you are not aware of the bearing of my secrets,
> understandingly so. First answer this question: where are we?
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> >
> > Perseus: Go on.  I'm willing to listen.
> >
> > OOC: I've been watching Beast Wars over again.  I forgot how fun it
> was! ^^
> >
> > On 4/23/07, Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:
> > >
> > >   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com <nbwrpg%40yahoogroups.com>, Kraftlos
> > > <kraftlos@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > OOC: Sorry I waited so long to reply... -_-
> > > >
> > > > BIC:
> > > >
> > > > Team one stood with weapons drawn, while Perseus spoke with the
> > > Predacon.
> > > >
> > > Dinobot looked intently at Perseus, all the while smiling knowingly.
> > >
> > > Dinobot: Negative. You can keep that one locked up as long as you
> > > wish. He is your and Hydras's problem. I have found that we all have
> > > bigger... much bigger ones, and I wish to discuss that with someone
> > > who will listen.
> > >
> > > > "I am Perseus, Maximal Commander in Atlantis...... That murderous
> > > bot is
> > > > working for Hydras? Then why was he attacking civilians and police
> > > > officers? We currently have him detained, and I would not be
> completely
> > > > opposed to negotiating a prisoner release, provided that we can
> avoid
> > > > hostilities, both now and in the future. Are you interested?"
> suggested
> > > > Perseus, still completely prepared for a violent confrontation.
> > > >
> > > > OOC: Radio silence. Doc shouldn't be calling over the radio unless
> > > it's an
> > > > emergency. :-/
> > > >
> > > > On 4/19/07, Nic <warriorazure@> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > OOC: And here I am! Let's transform and roll out, guys!
> > > > >
> > > > > Bic: Dinobot turned to Perseus, not very surprised of the
> wait, but
> > > > > more by the presentation. He hadn't expected Maximals to try for a
> > > > > sneakier approach.
> > > > >
> > > > > Dinobot: Finally! Well, Maximal, [grunt], some attention would
> > > > > certainly be welcome. I am Dinobot and I was sent out by Hydras to
> > > > > reclaim someone named Trelos. I have given him my word and have
> > > > > discovered many... details in my trip here.
> > > > >
> > > > > Higher up, Doc slowly adjusted his aim on Dinobot's head.
> > > > >
> > > > > Doc: You hear that, Rodimus? Should I hit him now?
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> <nbwrpg%40yahoogroups.com><nbwrpg%40yahoogrou
> > > ps.com>, Kraftlos
> > >
> > > > > <kraftlos@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > OOC: Just a reminder, I'm waiting on Nic to come back and play
> > > > > dinobot and
> > > > > > doc unless someone else wants to take over.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > On 4/4/07, Kraftlos <kraftlos@> wrote:
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > "Predacon. What do you want?" shouted Perseus from atop the
> > > ramp down
> > > > > > > into the port.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Guardia followed closely behind Rodimus. When she saw the
> > > > > Predacon, she
> > > > > > > pulled out her shield and pistol and prepared to cover team 1.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Meanwhile...
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > "Salveo here, lockdown is now complete. All personal with the
> > > > > exception
> > > > > > > of Kenzo will need command center authorization to move
> around the
> > > > > base." he
> > > > > > > said over the radio.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > "Understood...." said Lord Perseus, "We have contact with the
> > > target."
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > "Scanners still show only one threat. Be careful though."
> replied
> > > > > Salveo.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > "Right... initiate a brief radio silence. Do not break silence
> > > > > until I
> > > > > > > do, or if there is an emergency. Perseus out."
> > > > > > >

> > > > > > >

> > > > > > > >

> > > > > > > > taking team 2's position.

> tunnel.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > "Time to figure out what this is all about!" he said into
> > > the radio.
> > > > > > > > "Teams are now moving into the mission area."
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > Lord Perseus began moving along the street, first east, then
> > > north
> > > > > > > > toward the port, he had the team wait about a block
> before the
> > > > > ramp so he
> > > > > > > > could be certain his backup was in position.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >

> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > ::Rodimus Prime::
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > With Team 1 in place, Rodimus heads to the exit point
> of the
> > > > > tunnels,
> > > > > > > > > taking Team 2's position. Rodimus takes his stance, rifle
> > > > > drawn again.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Rodimus: Good luck, everyone.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > *Nic <warriorazure@>* wrote:
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Doc: Rodimus, come on, Team 1's in place!
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > He pressed on a bit faster.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Dinobot, outside, was still meditating. He had
> captured both
> > > > > Trelos's
> > > > > > > > > transmission and Hydras's answer. He smirked mentally. But
> > > he also
> > > > > > > > > heard the shudder, the barely perceptible trembling
> > > > > underground. The
> > > > > > > > > base was being protected somehow. First generation
> > > inspiration?
> > > > > > > > > Possibly, but that also meant he had to be ready.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > He stood up, not yet taking a combat stance. He was still
> > > waiting.
> > > > > > > > > They are Maximals and wouldn't fire first after all.
> > > > > > > > >

> to wind
> > > > > his way
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > up the
> > > > > > > > > > series of ramps that lead up to the surface. The end
> of the
> > > > > tunnel
> > > > > > > > > was
> > > > > > > > > > covered by an ordinarily-looking building. The exit was

> > > > > > > > > building

> > > > > > > > > goal is to
> > > > > > > > > > > get to the exit and leave in a manner that doesn't

> > > > > > > > > suspicion to the

> > > > > > > > > the port
> > > > > > > > > > > ramp to be about 4 streets to the north. (maximal
> base on
> > > > > the far
> > > > > > > > > east side
> > > > > > > > > > > of the city) I'm working on a comprehensive

> > > > > > > > > base on the

> > > > > > > > > takes a

> > > > > security

> > > > > > > > > every 20

> > > > > > > > > > > >

> > > > > followed

> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > The tunnel, which was more like a small alley,
> was very
> > > > > narrow;
> > > > > > > > > quite
> > > > > > > > > > > > possibly too narrow for larger bots. It was not very
> > > > > well lit,
> > > > > > > > > most of the
> > > > > > > > > > > > light in the tunnel was provided by the light
> which was
> > > > > > > > > filtering down from

> > > > > city.

> > > > > > > > > > > > light was minimal because the openings which were
> > > covered by
> > > > > > > > > thick grates
> > > > > > > > > > > > were well over two stories above the the walkway.
> > > > > > > > > > > >

> forcefield, the
> > > > > forcefield
> > > > > > > > > > > > deactivated, allowing him and the group to pass
> through.
> > > > > > > > > > > >
